stories.text:
Hi friends! 
I want to share with you a piece of news that makes us very happy. My team and I have been working hard for a while to launch the 2. version of our trust-building platform, Inspakt 2.0, and the launch day is closer than a month now. It counts as just the beginning, but it is still very exciting! What makes it even more exciting is partnering with the #1 marketplace for entrepreneurs AppSumo and hopefully will launch right after the 2. version. Wish us luck!
stories.title: Inspakt – Trust Building Platform is launching the second version

stories.text:
I'm currently on 18.04 LTS. It "ain't broken", which is the most compelling case for "don't fix"

On the other hand, 4 years is a long time! What new features have you found valuable?

Also feel free to ask context questions, since at some level the answer is obviously "It depends". Here are some high level things:

- This is my daily personal computer. Google mail/calendar/etc

- Programming Python through VSCode for AWS

- No intensive gaming

- Intel® Core™ i7-7700HQ CPU @ 2.80GHz × 8, and NVIDIA GEForce GTX GPU, on the theory that I will someday do neural network projects
stories.title: Ask HN: Should I upgrade Ubuntu to 22.04 LTS?
Why Vaccine Cards Are So Easily Forged
World’s Happiest Country Ranking Goes to Finland for Fifth Year in a Row

stories.text: linuxfromscratch.ORG is the correct website of the LFS project. linuxfromscratch.COM leads (through multiple redirects) to a website displaying a fake Windows Defender alert and asking the user to download malware.
stories.title: Tell HN: Linuxfromscratch.com Is a Scam Website
Over 400 Companies Have Withdrawn from Russia–But Some Remain
